boat.name: Bloodaxe
boat.full_description:
'Bloodaxe' is a steel double-chine bilge Gaff-Cutter-Ketch-rigged auxiliary motor sailing cruiser, with a displacement hull form of the Colin Archer type.

She has a raked and rounded stem with a steel bow-sprit arrangement and the stern is the canoe type, the superstructure and amidships open backed pilot house is nicely proportioned that gives the ship a purposeful appearance.

The hull, deck and superstructure is of fabricated construction built of profiled steel plate that is laid in the flush carvel style, the hull is of double-chine configuration and the centreline keel is the hollow trough type with internal ballast.

Her hull was built at Barton on Humber in 1999 as a shell, then fitted out by the shipwright W.Piper, with the work being completed in 2008. With 5 cabins (including the saloon) she gives generous accomodation for 6-7 people.
